title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: " To the town of Hilltown ? Then it is clear youcan't go there to-night—fifteen miles good, and whatis more, sir, you have to pass through the valley ofDrool. Impossible, sir! Why, you will never reachHilltown if you enter Drool Valley this night, I couldwager all my hens and pigeons.

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: " To the town of Hilltown ? Then it is clear youcan't go there to-night—fifteen miles good, and whatis more, sir, you have to pass through the valley ofDrool. Impossible, sir! Why, you will never reachHilltown if you enter Drool Valley this night, I couldwager all my hens and pigeons. No man ever getsclear through Drool that enters at night, I can tellyou.

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: " I mind well,it was the end o' spring—a frosty night, for a' it wasso near the summer. A lady knocked at this door,asking the road for Hilltown. We a' tried to persuadeher not to go, but she wouldna be moved.

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: " Frae the auld toon o' Embro, and am bound forHilltown, though, faith, I fear I'll be sair flegged toreach there this nicht."

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: And neither she was. Nobodyat Hilltown has ever seen her again. The more wasthe pity, for she was very beautiful.

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: " Oh no, it is all well past; but I'm not thinking ofcorn to-night. I am but a lone traveller on the wayto the town of Hilltown."

title: Tours in Scotland 1677 & 1681. By T. Kirk and R. Thoresby. Edited by P. Hume Brown
author: Kirk, Thomas

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: Well, now, did you everhear anything like this? Here is a gentleman whoproposes to go to Hilltown through Drool Valley.
